data.title: JFE Holdings, Inc.
data.text:
NKK and Kawasaki Steel jointly established JFE Holdings, a wholly owning parent company through share transfer.

Listed our common stock on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, the Osaka Securities Exchange and the Nagoya Stock Exchange First Section (the shares of both companies were delisted)

Reorganized both companies into JFE Steel, JFE Engineering, JFE Urban Development and JFE R&D through company split

Kawasaki Microelectronics, Inc. was implemented as a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company.

JFE Steel established the joint venture company, Guangzhou JFE Steel Sheet Co., Ltd. (currently Equity-method affiliate) to manufacture and sell hot-dip galvanized steel sheet Guangzhou Iron and Steel Enterprises Holdings Ltd., in China (In April 2012, changed the joint venture partner to Guangzhou Steel Sheets Co., Ltd.)

Acquired Universal Shipbuilding Corporation as a subsidiary through acquisition of shares owned by Hitachi Zosen Corporation and JFE Engineering

Transferred the research functions of JFE R&D, which related to engineering, to JFE Engineering, and also integrated JFE R&D into JFE Steel

JFE Steel merged with JFE Urban Development and succeed to the business of utlising the real property holding.

Guangzhou JFE Steel Sheet Co., Ltd (GJSS), a joint venture, began operating a cold rolling mill.
